screen_desc: The screenshot shows the home screen of a smartphone displaying multiple app icons, organized into rows. The top row features Google-related apps such as Photos, Maps, Gmail, Play Store, and Zoom. Below are additional apps like Adobe Acrobat, AliExpress, Camera, Chrome, Calendar, Contacts, Drive, and LinkedIn. The bottom row contains apps like McDonald's, Messages, Phone, and Google apps, with an "All apps" section for more icons. The screen shows a 3:39 PM timestamp in the top-left corner.
action_think: To uninstall the 'DoorDash - Food Delivery' app, I need to locate the app on the device. According to the screen description, the app is not visible on the current home screen. Therefore, my next action should be to access the list of all applications where I can find and uninstall the 'DoorDash' app. Since there is an 'All apps' section indicated in the screen description, I should navigate there to see the full list of installed apps.
action_plan: Open the 'All apps' section to view all installed apps.
Locate the 'DoorDash - Food Delivery' app in the list.
Select and hold the 'DoorDash - Food Delivery' app to access uninstallation options.
Choose the 'Uninstall' option to remove the app from the device.
action_result: By scrolling up on the last screenshot, the current screen now displays a different set of apps. However, the app "DoorDash - Food Delivery" is still not visible on this screen. This action has not visibly progressed the request to uninstall "DoorDash - Food Delivery," as the app in question needs to be found first in order for it to be uninstalled. It may be necessary to continue scrolling through the app list or use the search feature to locate the app if it is installed on the device.
